titleStmt.title: Taʾāmra Māryām “Miracles of Mary” / Taʾāmra ʾIyasus “Miracles of Jesus” / Maṣḥafa ṭomār “Book of the Letter (from Heaven)”

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / beta maṣāḥǝft

licence.p: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

msContents.summary:
I) Taʾāmra Māryām “Miracles of Mary" (fols. 4ra-94rb) I-1) Excerpt from the Maṣḥafa śǝrʿāt, Introductory rite of al-Muʿallaqah (fol. 4ra-va) I-2) ʾAkkonu bǝʾǝsi... “Does not the man...” (fols. 4va-8ra) I-3) Maṣḥafa śǝrʿāt, Introductory rite of al-Muʿallaqah (fol. 9ra-12va) I-4) Introductory exhortation and hymns (fols. 12vb-15rb) I-5) ʾƎsaggǝd laki wa-ʾǝweddǝsaki ... “I worship Thee ...” (fols. 15va-16rb) I-6) Taʾāmra Māryām “Miracles of Mary”: 60 miracles (fols. 16rb-94ra) I-7) Salām laki ḫoḫǝtä mǝśraq... “Salutation to you, Threshold of the East…” (fol. 94ra-rb) II) Taʾāmra ʾIyasus “Miracles of Jesus” (fols. 95ra-125rb) II-1) Story of the family of Adam (fols. 95ra-99vb) II-2) Taʾāmra ʾIyasus “Miracles of Jesus”: 18 miracles (fols. 99vb-125rb) III) Maṣḥafa ṭomār “Book of the Letter (from Heaven)” (fols. 126ra-133va)
Additiones 1-4.

msItem.note: Text I-2 comprises 31 strophes which are strophes 1-5, 7-31, 33 according to GrohHymn pp. 336-53.
Text I-3, partly with interlineal musical notation, contains:
- Ṣalota [za-yǝbǝl] ʾǝmqǝdmä [yanbǝbu] taʾammǝr ... “Prayer [recited] before [reading] the Miracles ..." (12va)
- ʾO-ʾǝgzǝʾtǝyä qǝddǝst dǝngǝl Māryām walādita ʾamlāk ... “O my Lady, Holy Virgin Mary, Godbearing ...” (14rb l.3-rb l.18)
- ʾO-ʾǝgzǝʾtǝyä qǝddǝst dǝngǝl Māryām Mariham ʾǝmmu la-ʾIyasus Krǝstos kahāli ... "O my Lady, Holy Virgin Mary, Mother of Jesus Christ the Almighty ..." (14rb-va) (cp. ChRep n373)
- salām laki ʾo-ʾǝgzǝʾtǝyä qǝddǝst dǝngǝl Māryām ʾǝmma madḫǝn wa-ʾǝmma bǝrhān ... "Salutation to you, o my Lady, Holy Virgin Mary, Mother of the Saviour and Mother of the Light ..." (14va-15rb).
The miracles of Mary (Text I-6) are numbered. Text I-7 is followed by a short note which determines when the short hymn has to be read.

The miracles of Jesus (Text II-2) are numbered. The scribe numbered the introduction as miracles 1 and 2. Text II is followed by a short hymn: ʾƎgziʾa sanbat wald …, the incipit reads as follows, 125rb: እግዚአ፡ ሰንበት፡ ወልድ፡ ሶበ፡ አርአየ፡ ነቢረ፡ ተአምር፡ በሰንበት፡ …

supportDesc.extent:
Made of 135.0 folios, of which blank 2v-3v, 94v, 134v-135v., in 16.0 quires (A+14+B).
250 215 80

collation.signatures: Decorated - Decorated quire marks (rubrication has not been executed) are often written twice (partly faded), in the inner upper corner of the first and last folio of the quires on 18v: ፩, 19r: ፪, 29r/38v: ፫, 39r/48v: ፬, 49r: ፭, 59r/68v: ፮, 69r/76v: ፯, 77r/84v: ፰, 85r/94v: ፱, 95r/104v: ፲, 105r/113v: ፲፩, 114r/123v: ፲፪, 124r/133v: ፲፫.

list.item: 2 A(2; s.l.: 1, stub after 1; 2, stub before 2/fols. 1r-2v)

10
፫IV፫(10; s.l.: 3, stub after 8; 8, stub after 3/fols. 29r-38v)

10
፲XI፲(10; s.l.: 3, stub after 8; 8, stub after 3/fols. 95-104v)
2 B(2; s.l.: 1, stub after 1; 2, stub before 2/fols. 134r-135v)

supportDesc.condition: 9r-16r with the Texts I-3 and I-4 show traces of extensive use. The leather cover on both boards is partly torn off at the upper edges. The Ms. was resewn and an overback added (partly detached from the spine). Quire I, of different size and colour; has been added at a later stage. Holes or tears amended on 26, 41, 45, 78, 110, 112.

layout.ab: The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.
The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.
Some fols. have one or two additional ruled lines at the bottom (21rv, 26rv, 78r).

handDesc.handNote:
Hand a: careful. Hand b: mediocre. Black, red (hand a: brilliant red, hand b: vivid red). Lǝʿula QālLǝʿula Qāl (hand b) is mentioned as the scribe in the concluding supplication of Text I-6 on 93vb.19th century (?) Nomina sacra; names of the commissioners; the word salām "salutation" in Texts I-3 and I-5, abbreviated directives for the ministers in Text I-3, the word sanbat “Sabbath” in Text III; elements of the punctuation signs and of the text dividers; elements of Ethiopic numerals.
Two lines of the incipit of Text I-1, alternating with black lines; the first word or its abbreviated form of each strophe of Text I-2; several groups of lines on the incipit page of Texts I-3, II and III, alternating with black lines; two initial lines of the incipit of Texts I-4, I-5 and I-6; one or two initial lines of sections of Texts I-3, I-4; two initial lines of the sections of Texts I-6, II and III.
Hand a: 4ra-8ra (quire I); conspicuously right-sloping letters with long vowel markers.
Hand b, Lǝʿula Qāl: 9ra-133va (quires II-XIV); broad, roundly shaped letters, thick vertical lines.

list.item: f. 8rb: Note concerning the local maḥbär-association (?)

ff. 125va: Excerpts from Säʿatat za-lelit “Horologium for the Night” (MSLN p. 116). 125va: ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ጥዑመ፡ ስም፡ ለዘይጼውዖ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ኅብስተ፡ ሕይወት፡ ለዘይበልዖ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ጽዋዓ፡ መድኃኒት፡ ለዘይሠውዖ፡ ከመ፡ ይባርኩነ፡ ይፈኑ፡ አርዳኦ፡ ለጸባኢነ፡ ይጽብኦ፡ ወልታሁ፡ ነሢኦ። 125va: አመ፡ ትመጽእ፡ ለኰንኖ፡ ምስለ፡ ደመ፡ ገቦ፡ ወአእጋር። አማሕፀንኩ፡ ነፍስየ፡ ውስት፡ እዴከ፡ ክቡር፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ እግዚአ፡ሰማያት፡ ወምድር። ይትዋቀሱ፡ በእንቲአየ፡ ትኰርዖትከ፡ በበትር። ወትሠይጦትከ፡ ከመ፡ ገብር፡ ለኅዳጥ፡ ብሩር። ሃሌ፡ ሉያ፡ በል።
Both excerpts are written in red, in the same secondary hand.

ff. 125va-vb: Taʾāmra Gabra Manfas Qǝddus "Miracles of Gabra Manfas Qǝddus": 1 miracle.
Two initial lines and the name of the protagonist are rubricated.

ff. 134ra-rb: Note on commissioning the writing. 134ra: ዝንቱ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ ዘመቅደሰ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ አብርቆ፡ ዘአጽሐፍዋ፡ በ፩፡ ምክር፡ ደቂቀ፡ አብርቆ፡ በዘመነ፡ ቄስ፡ ገበዝ፡ ቴዎድሮስ፡ ወእምድኅሬሁ፡ ቀሲስ፡ ተስፋ፡ ጽዮን፡ ወወሀብዋ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ከመ፡ ትኩኖሙ፡ መድኃኒተ፡ ነፍስ፡ ወሥጋ፡ ዘሠረዋ፡ ወዘፈሐቋ፡ ወዘተአገላ፡ ወዘተጓሕለዋ፡ በሥልጣነ፡ ጴጥሮስ፡ ወጳውሎስ፡ ውጉዘ፡ ለይኩን። ዝንቱ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ ሥርናይ፡ ውእቱ፡ ዘአልቦ፡ ክርዳድ፡ እለ፡ ታነብቡ፡ ቀሲስ፡ አው፡ ዲያቆን፡ ኢትርሥዑኒ፡ ጊዜ፡ ጸሎት። 134rb: ወካዕበ፡ እነግረክሙ፡ ኦአበውየ፡ ካህናት፡ ወአኃውየ፡ ዲያቆናት፡ ከመ፡ ኢታጽርዑ፡ አንበቦተ፡ ዝንቱ፡መጽሐፍ፡ በበዓላተ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ወበሰንበት፡ ወበበዓላተ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ከመ፡ ኢትኅጐሉ፡ እምባረከታ፡ ለድንግል፡ ንጽሕት።
The note is written in the main hand. It states that the Ms. was commissioned by the community of ʾAbrǝqo during the tenure of qes gabaz Tewodros and, after him, qasis Tasfā Ṣǝyon. The note is followed by an exhortation to read this Ms. on the feast days of God, on Sunday and on the feast days of St Mary.

- Lists of the members of the local maḥbär-association (?), in ink, pen and pencil: 1r-2r. - Immediate correction is indicated by thin lines above and below the words to be cancelled on 7ra. - Omitted letters or words inserted interlineally: e.g., 11ra, 15va, 17vb, 19rb, 22vb, 27rb, 33vb, 43rab, 45va, 58rb, 68vb, 81va, 95rb, 102vb, 124va, 126rb. - Thin black and/or red lines for line filling: e.g., 15ra, 21ra, 22ra, 88vb. - Dittographical errors are marked with red or black lines around the words: 45rb, 50va, 52va, 104rb.

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards covered with dark brown tooled leather. Overback made of reddish-brown tooled leather. Two pairs of sewing stations.
Remains and traces (holes) of two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover.

Blind tooled ornament on the dark brown leather cover is poorly visible (at least 6 tools were used: triple line fillet, double circle, small x, corni-from, double sine wave with dots, double crescent). Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown overback (1 tool was used: single line fillet).

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.

person.persName: According to Additio 3, the Ms. was commissioned by community of ʾAbrǝqo during the tenure of qes gabaz Tewodros and, after him, qasis Tasfā Ṣǝyon. Both names are written in supplication formulas (12vb, 16rb, 20vb etc), in hand b. In addition, many other names are mentioned like Za-ʾIyasus (23vb, 25vb, 28ra etc.) and ʿAmda Mikāʾel (26rb, 30vb, 37ra etc.); interlineally in a secondary hand: Fǝśśǝḥa Giyorgis and Takla Giyorgis (12vb, 18rb, 32rb, 44ra etc.). The nameof Tewodros Walda Giyorgis is written, not rubricated, in the supplication on 4va, in hand a.

revisionDesc.change: transformed from mycore to TEI P5
